1:
AVSEC ORDER NO. 2 / 2002 
 
 
Sub: Security measure 
 
 
In exercise of the powers, conferred by Section 5A of the Aircraft Act, 
1934 (XII of 1934), delegated to him by the Central Government vide the 
Government of India, Ministry of Civil Aviation notification S.O. number 1797, 
dated the 3rd July, 1997, the Commissioner of Security, Civil Aviation, Bureau of 
Civil Aviation Security, for the purpose of security of the aircraft operations, 
directs that the following items be banned for carriage by a passenger on board 
the flight operating from civil Indian Airports and Indian registered aircrafts 
operating from foreign airports: 
 
1. 
Lighter 
2. 
Match Box 
3. 
Swiss Knife 
4. 
Pen knife, 
5. 
Betel Nut cutters, 
6. 
Knife, scissor exceeding 2 + ½ “ in length, 
7. 
Any other sharp metallic object, and 
8. 
Umbrella 
 
 
( Veeranna Aivalli ) 
Commissioner of  Security  (CA) 
 
 
Case  No.CAS-7 (1) / 97.Div.I  Dated :  01.05.2002 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
In order to streamline the process of pre-embarkation screening of 
passengers and their hand baggage and also to avoid congestion at the security 
check point, a line will be drawn 10 feet short of security hold area and ASG staff 
on duty responsible for queuing shall ensure that the passengers proceed one by 
one for security check. This shall be strictly implemented. 
 
(  R.K. Singh ) 
Addl. Commissioner of  Security  (CA) 
 
 
Case  No.CAS-8(44)/97.Div.I  Dated :  08.02.2002
